_header: Mine high estate power and authority
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 205; bad key, TP 180.
_description: The preface to the Book of Fortune, on the cast of the dice, by Thomas More — thirty-seven stanzas rhyme royal

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Myne high estate power & auctoryteYf ye ne know enserche &
                    ye shall spie…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…In euery poynt eche answere by & byAs ar þe
                    Iugementis of AstronomyeExplicit
OxfBal354.Note:
In three parts; heading to Part I: ‘The wordis of / ffortune to
                    þe people’ (p. 213).
